title: Drawing, "Pair of Scissors with Handles Formed by Seated Half-pairs of Facing Llamas, or Camels."
medium: Pen and ink, brush and gray wash on heavy off-white paper
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite at upper right: 41
Verso: Inscribed in graphite across sheet:  P 12 - / upper right - / Leave paper /  2 / C
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle showing a pair of scissors with handles formed by seated half-pairs of facing llamas, or possibly camels.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Pair of Scissors with Handles Formed by Seated Half-pairs of Facing Llamas, or Camels.".
Pen and ink, brush and gray wash on heavy off-white paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5462.
